description: Borrowed from Ottoman Turkish علما‎ (ulemâ), from Arabic عُلَمَاء‎ (ʕulamāʔ), plural of عَالِم‎ (ʕālim, “learned one”).

entries.meaning: plural of alim; the guardians of legal and religious tradition in Islam; clerics.
examples: In process of time, the whole monopoly of the ulema centred in a certain number of families; and their constant residence at the capital, to which they return at the expiration of their term of office, has maintained their power to the present day.
